data.title: Info about Victoria Azarenka – United Athletes Magazine
data.meta_description: Information about Victoria Azarenka, Belarusian tennis player.
data.text:
Information about Victoria Azarenka

Personal facts

About her

Tennis player

Born July 31, 1989

Minsk, USSR (now Byelorussia)

1.80 m (5 feet 10 inches)

60 kg (132 pounds)

Family

Parents: Alla and Fedor Azarenka

Sibling: one brother

Accomplishments

Victories in singles

Winner in Monterrey, Mexico by beating Garbiñe Muguruza: 2016.

Winner in Indian Wells, United States by beating Serena Williams: 2016.

Winner in Brisbane, Australia by beating Angelique Kerber: 2016.

Winner in Cincinnati, United States by beating Serena Williams: 2013.

Winner in Doha, Qatar by beating Serena Williams: 2013.

Winner at the Australian Open in Melbourne by beating Li Na: 2013.

Winner in Linz, Austria by beating Julia Görges: 2012.

Winner in Beijing, China by beating Maria Sharapova: 2012.

Winner in Indians Wells, United States by beating Maria Sharapova: 2012.

Winner in Doha, Qatar, Australia by beating Samantha Stosur: 2012.

Winner at the Australian Open in Melbourne by beating Maria Sharapova: 2012.

Winner in Sydney, Australia by beating Li Na: 2012.

Winner in Luxembourg by beating Monica Niculescu: 2011.

Winner in Marbella, Spain by beating Irina-Camelia Begu: 2011.

Winner in Miami, United States by beating Maria Sharapova: 2011.

Winner in Moscow, Russia by beating Maria Kirilenko: 2010.

Winner in San Jose, United States by beating Maria Sharapova: 2010.

Winner in Miami, United States by beating Serena Williams: 2009.

Winner in Memphis, United States by beating Caroline Wozniacki: 2009.

Winner in Brisbane, Australia by beating Marion Bartoli: 2009.

Winner in Luxembourg (ITF) by beating Viktoriya Kutuzova: 2005.

Victories in doubles

Winner with her Australian partner Ashleigh Barty in Rome, Italy: 2019.

Winner with her Chinese partner Zheng Saisai in Acapulco, Mexico: 2019.

Winner with her Russian partner Maria Kirilenko in San Jose, United States: 2011.

Winner with her Russian partner Maria Kirilenko in Madrid, Spain: 2011.

Winner with her Russian partner Maria Kirilenko in Cincinnati, United States: 2010.

Winner with her Russian partner Vera Zvonareva in Indian Wells, United States: 2009.

Winner with her Danish partner Caroline Wozniacki in Memphis, United States: 2009.

Winner with her Belarusian partner Tatiana Poutchek in Tashkent, Uzbekistan: 2006.

Victories in mixed doubles

Winner with American partner Bob Bryan at Roland-Garros in Paris, France: 2008.

Winner with Belarusian partner Max Mirnyi at the US Open in New York, United States: 2007.

Olympic Games

She participated in 2 Olympic Games in Beijing, China (2008) and London, United Kingdom (2012) by representing Belarus.

Fed Cup

She participated 8 times in Fed Cup (2005, 2007, 2009 to 2011, 2015, 2016 and 2019) by representing Belarus.

Tennis facts

Plays

Right-handed

Two-handed backhand

World ranking

During the interview (August 18, 2009), she was ranked 9th in the world in singles according to the Women's Tennis Association (WTA).

Her best WTA world ranking in singles is the 1st place on January 30, 2012.

© United Athletes Magazine
